summary: The Parents Opt-in Protection Act (H.R. 4986) amends the General Education Provisions Act to require prior written consent before a student participates in surveys, analyses, or evaluations revealing personal information about themselves or their family. For adult students and emancipated minors, their consent is required. For unemancipated minors, parental consent is mandated. The bill aims to protect student and family privacy regarding sensitive personal data collected by educational institutions.
